Performance Audit Governance of Artificial Intelligence at the Australian Taxation Office

This document is the Auditor-General Report No. 26 2024–25, conducted by the Australian National Audit Office, focusing on a performance audit of the governance of Artificial Intelligence (AI) within the Australian Taxation Office (ATO). The report details the findings of an audit specifically examining the ATO's approach to managing and overseeing the use of AI technologies. It highlights the processes and controls in place, assessing their effectiveness and alignment with best practices. The report likely scrutinizes aspects such as data governance, algorithmic bias, risk management, ethical considerations, and compliance with relevant regulations surrounding AI implementation. Given the sensitive nature of tax administration and the potential impact of AI on individual taxpayers, the audit's scope probably includes evaluating the ATO's strategies for ensuring fairness, transparency, and accountability in its AI-driven operations. The document includes standard copyright and licensing information, specifying a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 3.0 Australia license, granting permission for non-commercial use with attribution to the Australian National Audit Office. It emphasizes the importance of adhering to the license terms, prohibiting alterations or adaptations of the document. Furthermore, the report outlines the procedures for obtaining permission to utilize copyrighted material from third parties, ensuring proper attribution and compliance with intellectual property rights. The inclusion of the Commonwealth Coat of Arms and the licensing terms underscore the official nature of the document and the associated legal framework. The report’s purpose is to provide an independent assessment of the ATO’s AI governance framework, contributing to improved oversight and responsible innovation within the organization.
